Olive and Arthur, are not allowed to replace the thatch with tiles because of this and re-thatching such a house would cost in excess of Â£5,000. Ugley Green has no shops, but it does have its own post box and public telephone kiosk. A track leads from Ugley Green across Church Common to Ugley itself. The name harps back to Ucga the Saxon who came across the North Sea to start a new life, and having cleared a patch in the forest built a hall and a church on which the present Ugley Hall and St Peters Church stand.
